newsitem.title: CHINA: Beijing chemical plant blast kills three.
newsitem.headline: Beijing chemical plant blast kills three.

text.p: A huge explosion at a chemical factory in suburban Beijing killed at least three people and injured 64, city government officials said on Saturday.

The blast that rocked the Dongfang Chemical Factory in Beijing's Tong county at around 9.30 p.m. (0130 GMT) on Friday sent shards of metal cascading across nearby streets and blew out windows up to a kilometre (0.6 miles) away.
"It was a huge explosion," said one resident. "We all ran -- it was terrifying."
An official of the Beijing city government said a fire had broken out in a storage-tank area at the chemical plant, killing three people. Of the 64 injured, 12 were seriously hurt, he said.
Beijing municipal leaders had gone to the scene of the disaster and the cause of the fire was under investigation, he said but gave no details.
Sheets of flame and plumes of black smoke continued to pour out of the factory at midday on Saturday, while fire engines and ambulances rushed to and from the site.
